subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Coyote: Native American Trickster
description: Learn Coyote: Native American Trickster in one minute.

hook.text: Coyote stole fire for humans, created death by accident, and can't stop tripping over his own cleverness.

buildup.text: In many Native American traditions, Coyote is both creator and fool. He shapes the world through mistakes.

discovery.text: Coyote brought fire to humans by stealing it from the fire spirits. But his tricks often backfire hilariously.

twist.text: Coyote accidentally created death. He tried to undo it but couldn't. Even tricksters can't escape their own chaos.

climax.text: Coyote teaches through failure. His stories say: the world is messy, mistakes are unavoidable, and that's okay.

punchline.text: Coyote created the world through mistakes. Mythology's lovable fool.

quiz.question: What lesson do Coyote stories teach?
options: The world is messy and mistakes are part of life
